ClearAllCmdHdr.Title: Close
ClearAllCmdHdr.LongHelp:
All selected content is closed from the view.

If no content is selected, all content is closed from the view.
LargeTilesLayoutCmdHdr.Title: Large Tiles View
TilesLayoutCmdHdr.Title: Tiles View
ThumbnailsLayoutCmdHdr.Title: Thumbnails View
CompareHdr.Title: Compare Structure
CompareHdr.ShortHelp: Opens the Compare widget to show the differences between the selected objects, or between the selected object and another structure or filter.
CompareHdr.LongHelp: If you selected only one object, load another object in the right section of Compare's home page.
DeleteHdr.Title: Delete
DeleteHdr.LongHelp: If you select one object, to also delete its children, select the Include structural objects option.
RecycleBinHdr.Title: Recycle Bin
RecycleBinHdr.ShortHelp: Opens the recycle bin that contains deactivated system models.
RecycleBinHdr.LongHelp: From the recycle bin, you can permanently delete system models, or restore them. These capabilities are only available for system models.
DuplicateHdr.Title: Duplicate
DuplicateHdr.ShortHelp: Creates another object using the content of the selected object.
DuplicateHdr.LongHelp:
Instead of creating an object from scratch, you can use an existing object as a starting point, and keep traceability to the original object.

Duplicates provide fewer capabilities than branches when you replace or compare an object's revision with another revision.

For some object types, the Advanced Duplicate command lets you duplicate structures and choose to duplicate, reuse, or exclude each child object.
HistoryHdr.Title: Revisions
HistoryHdr.ShortHelp: Displays the revisions and branches of the selected object. You can also display its duplicates.
HistoryHdr.LongHelp:
The links between objects and the lifecycle icons show the lifecycle operation that created them.

Use the toolbar to navigate and resize the display. You can also display the graph list view to see the objects in a spreadsheet.
IterationsHdr.Title: Iterations
IterationsHdr.ShortHelp: Displays the iterations of the selected representation.
IterationsHdr.LongHelp: In the dialog box, select an iteration on the iteration line at the bottom to display information about it.
MaturityHdr.Title: Maturity
MaturityHdr.ShortHelp: Modifies the maturity state of the selected objects.
MaturityHdr.LongHelp: In the dialog box, select the target state from the maturity graph if you selected one object, or from the list if you selected several objects. Then, click OK.
NewBranchHdr.Title: New Branch
NewBranchHdr.ShortHelp: Creates a revision of the selected objects in a new branch.
NewBranchHdr.LongHelp:
A revision captures a content evolution of the object.

Branches provide more capabilities than duplicates when you replace or compare an object's revision with another revision.

For some object types, the Advanced New Branch command lets you create branches of structures and choose to reuse, exclude, or create a branch of each child object.
ReviseFromHdr.Title: New Revision From
ReviseFromHdr.ShortHelp: Creates a revision of the selected structure using the content of another revision, branch, or duplicate.
ReviseFromHdr.LongHelp:
You can use this command to merge branches.

A revision captures a content evolution of the object, that you can modify afterward.

In the dialog box, select the source. Then, choose an option for each child node: revise, reuse, exclude, or insert as new.
MergeHdr.Title: Merge
MergeHdr.ShortHelp: Synchronizes the content of the selected structure with another branch of the same structure.
MergeHdr.LongHelp:
You can use this command to merge branches, in a new revision or not.

In the dialog box, select the source. Then, choose an option for each child node: revise, keep, overwrite, or remove.
RevisionHdr.Title: New Revision
RevisionHdr.ShortHelp: Creates a revision of the selected object in the same branch.
RevisionHdr.LongHelp: A revision captures a content evolution of the object, that you can modify afterward.
